result.execSummary:
The defendant Glenn D Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to use or possess any dangerous weapons including firearms.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases

COMPLY with Day Report Center for 3 WEEKS, consecutive to the Huber sentence. Good Time NOT allowed on DRC. If defendant scuccessfully completes the Day Report Center, the 3 weeks of stayed Huber will be permanently stayed.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. Cases 14CT385 & 15CM2031 were dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 06/10/16 by 12pm. LAST 3 weeks are Stayed.

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 233 days were granted.
Costs previously imposed were converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court, in custody, with attorney David L Herring.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called for sentencing hearing after revocation.  Attorney Nickolie makes recommendations.  Attorney Herring makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

Court orders the following: 

12 Months Straight Time in the Waukesha County Jail commencing FORTHWITH. Credit for 233 days.   (4 months and 7 days remains) 

All fines/costs/restitution previously ordered that remain unpaid shall be converted to a civil judgment

Appeal rights given and felony warnings given
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Glenn D Chapman, in custody (Court waives his appearance in the courtroom), with attorney David Herring.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Herring requests a short adjournment for the sentencing after revocation.  Court grants.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for October 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Transcript from Sentencing 6-3-16
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 16, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Dated 09/29/16. Day Report Center Direct Court Notification Notice; Defendant completed supervision.
DRC informational court report dated 08/29/16.

Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Marchan makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   **Concurrent with Case #16CM902**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____Not to use or possess and dangerous weapons to include firearms
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  90 Days (last 3 weeks stayed), Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 6/10/16 by 12:00 p.m. 
                               DAY REPORT CENTER:  3 weeks, consecutive to to huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If Defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 3 weeks of huber stayed will be  
                                                                       permanently stayed.  

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
